get.description:
List projects.

Retrieve a list of projects. This endpoint is typically used by system administrators
to manage multiple tenant projects.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Create project.

Create a new project (tenant). This automatically generates an API key for the project
and publishes a project creation event for AI Service synchronization.

get.description: Get project details.

patch.description:
Update project.

Update project information. This publishes a project update event
for AI Service synchronization.

delete.description:
Delete project (soft delete).

Soft delete a project. This publishes a project deletion event
for AI Service synchronization and cleanup.

get.description:
Get default AI model configuration for a project.

If a record does not exist yet, create an empty configuration and return it (HTTP 200).

put.description:
Upsert default AI model configuration for a project.

- Validates provider IDs belong to the same project
- Optionally validates model is in provider.available_models when both provided

post.description:
Staff login.

Authenticate staff member and return JWT access token.
Also registers/synchronizes user with WuKongIM for instant messaging.

get.description:
List staff members.

Retrieve a paginated list of staff members with optional filtering.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Create staff member.

Create a new staff member or AI agent. For AI agents, validates agent_id
with AI Service and publishes agent creation event.

get.description: Get staff member details.

patch.description:
Update staff member.

Update staff member information. For AI agents, validates agent_id changes
with AI Service and publishes agent update event.

delete.description:
Delete staff member (soft delete).

Soft delete a staff member. For AI agents, publishes agent deletion event
for AI Service cleanup.

get.description: Get the current status of WuKongIM integration including configuration and health.

post.description: Check which staff members are currently online in WuKongIM.
Synchronize recent conversations from WuKongIM for the current staff member.
Set the unread message count for a specific conversation.

schema.title: Response Set Conversation Unread V1 Staff Wukongim Conversations Set Unread Post

post.description: Delete a specific conversation from WuKongIM.

schema.title: Response Delete Conversation V1 Staff Wukongim Conversations Delete Post

post.description: Synchronize messages from a specific WuKongIM channel.

get.description:
List visitors.

Retrieve a paginated list of visitors with optional filtering by platform,
online status, and search query.

post.description:
Create visitor.

Create a new visitor record. Requires either platform_id or platform_type.
If platform_type is provided, uses the default platform of that type.

Register a visitor using a Platform API key (visitor-facing use).

- Authenticates via platform_api_key
- Creates or returns an existing visitor bound to the platform/project
- Returns channel info for messaging integration
Record a visitor activity from the client-side integration. Authenticate using the platform API key and supply the visitor ID.

get.description:
Get visitor details by channel identifiers.

Logic:
- channel_type == CHANNEL_TYPE_CUSTOMER_SERVICE (251): channel_id format is "{visitor_uuid}-vtr"
- channel_type == 1: channel_id is the visitor_id directly
- otherwise: 400 unsupported channel type

Get basic visitor information without heavy related entities.

This endpoint is optimized for quick lookups and avoids loading tags, AI data,
system info, or recent activities. It only loads the platform relation to
populate platform_type if available.
Get visitor details.

patch.description:
Update visitor.

Update visitor information including contact details and activity status.

delete.description:
Delete visitor (soft delete).

Soft delete a visitor record. This also removes all associated assignments and tags.

put.description: Set visitor profile attributes including custom fields.

post.description: Enable AI for a visitor (set ai_disabled=False).
Disable AI for a visitor (set ai_disabled=True).
Visitor-facing endpoint to retrieve historical messages from a channel.

get.description:
List assignments.

Retrieve a paginated list of visitor assignments with optional filtering.

post.description:
Create assignment.

Create a new visitor assignment. Validates visitor and staff existence,
and publishes assignment event for AI Service coordination.

get.description: Get assignment details.

patch.description:
Update assignment.

Update assignment notes or other mutable fields.

get.description:
List tags.

Retrieve a paginated list of tags with optional filtering by category and search.

post.description:
Create tag.

Create a new tag for categorization. Tag ID is automatically generated
as Base64 encoded string from name and category.

get.description: Get tag details.

patch.description:
Update tag.

Update tag properties like weight, color, and description.
Name and category cannot be changed as they determine the tag ID.

delete.description:
Delete tag (soft delete).

Soft delete a tag. This also removes all visitor-tag associations.

post.description:
Create visitor-tag association.

Associate a tag with a visitor for categorization purposes.

delete.description:
Delete visitor-tag association (hard delete).

Permanently remove the association between a visitor and a tag.
This action cannot be undone.

Delete visitor-tag association by visitor ID and tag ID (hard delete).

Permanently remove the association between a specific visitor and a specific tag.
This endpoint allows deletion using the visitor_id and tag_id directly,
without needing to know the visitor_tag association ID.
This action cannot be undone.

get.description: List available platform type definitions.

schema.title: Response List Platform Types V1 Platforms Types Get

get.description:
List platforms.

Retrieve a paginated list of communication platforms with optional filtering.

post.description:
Create platform.

Create a new communication platform configuration.

get.description: Retrieve platform information using Platform API key (visitor-facing).
Get platform details.

patch.description:
Update platform.

Update platform configuration and settings.

delete.description:
Delete platform (soft delete).

Soft delete a platform. This also affects all visitors associated with this platform.

post.description: Regenerate the API key for a platform.
Enable a platform (set is_active=True).
Disable a platform (set is_active=False).
Enable AI for a platform (set ai_disabled=False).
Disable AI for a platform (set ai_disabled=True).

Upload or replace the logo image for a platform (staff-only).

- Auth: JWT staff via get_current_active_user
- File: multipart/form-data field 'file'
- Validates MIME type and file size; stores under PLATFORM_LOGO_UPLOAD_DIR/{platform_id}/

get.description: Serve the stored logo image for a platform (public access).

WeCom () callback URL verification (GET).

WeCom sends msg_signature, timestamp, nonce, and echostr for verification.
We verify the signature and decrypt echostr (if encryption enabled), then
return the decrypted plain text as the response body.

post.description:
Forward third-party platform callbacks to the TGO Platform Service.

- Validates the platform_api_key against platforms table (must be active and not soft-deleted)
- Forwards body and query parameters to Platform Service
- Returns Platform Service response verbatim (status, headers, body)

get.description: List AI providers with pagination and optional filtering/search.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description: Create a new AI provider configuration for current project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

get.description: Get a single AI provider by ID.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters
Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description: Enable an AI provider.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description: Manually trigger sync of a single AI provider to tgo-ai.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description: Disable an AI provider.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Test connection/credentials for an AI provider.

Performs a lightweight GET request to provider's models/list endpoint
using the stored API key. Returns success flag and message.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

get.description:
Retrieve all collections for the authenticated project with filtering and pagination.
    
    Collections are used to organize documents and files for RAG operations.
    All results are automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

parameters.name: display_name

schema.description: Filter by collection display name (partial match)
schema.title: Display Name

parameters.description: Filter by collection display name (partial match)

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Create a new collection within the authenticated project for organizing documents and files.
    
    Collections help organize RAG content and can contain metadata about embedding models,
    chunk sizes, and other processing parameters. Collection is automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific collection including metadata
    and optional statistics about contained documents and files. Collection must belong to the authenticated project.

parameters.name: include_stats

schema.description: Include document and file count statistics
schema.title: Include Stats

parameters.description: Include document and file count statistics

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

patch.description:
Update an existing collection's properties including display name, description,
    tags, and metadata. Only provided fields will be updated. Collection must belong
    to the authenticated project and cannot be soft-deleted.

    This endpoint allows partial updates - you only need to provide the fields you want to change.
    All other fields will remain unchanged.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

delete.description:
Delete a specific collection by its UUID. This will set collection_id to NULL
    for associated files and documents but will not delete them. Collection must belong to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Perform semantic search for documents within a specific collection.
    
    This endpoint provides collection-scoped search capabilities for RAG operations.
    All results are automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

get.description:
Retrieve all files for the authenticated project with filtering and pagination.
    
    Files represent uploaded documents that are processed for RAG operations.
    All results are automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Upload a new file for RAG processing within the authenticated project.
    
    The file will be stored and queued for document extraction and embedding generation.
    Supported formats: PDF, Word documents, text files, and markdown files.
    All files are automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

413.description: File too large - exceeds maximum allowed size

415.description: Unsupported media type - file type not allowed

post.description:
Upload multiple files for RAG processing within the authenticated project in a single batch operation.

    All files will be stored and queued for document extraction and embedding generation.
    The response includes details about successful uploads and any failures.
    Supported formats: PDF, Word documents, text files, and markdown files.
    All files are automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

413.description: One or more files too large - exceeds maximum allowed size

415.description: Unsupported media type - one or more file types not allowed

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific file including processing status
    and metadata about generated documents. File must belong to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

delete.description:
Delete a specific file by its UUID. This will also delete all associated
    document chunks and remove the file from storage. File must belong to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

get.description:
Download a file by its ID with appropriate headers for browser download.

    Downloads the original file content with proper Content-Type, Content-Disposition,
    and other headers for browser compatibility. The file must belong to the authenticated project.

    Security features:
    - Validates file belongs to authenticated project
    - Prevents unauthorized access to files
    - Verifies file exists and is not deleted
    - Supports Unicode filenames with proper encoding

403.description: Forbidden - file doesn't belong to user's project

404.description: File not found or not accessible

500.description: Internal server error - file system error

get.description: List models with pagination and optional filtering/search.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters
Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

schema.title: Response Ingest Ai Event V1 Ai Events Post

get.description:
List teams for the authenticated project with filtering and pagination.
    
    Teams are used to organize AI agents and define shared configurations like LLM models
    and system instructions. All results are automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Create a new team within the authenticated project for organizing AI agents.
    
    Teams define shared configurations like LLM models, system instructions, and expected output formats.
    Only one default team is allowed per project. Team is automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific team including associated agents
    with their tools and collections. Team must belong to the authenticated project.

parameters.name: include_agents

schema.description: Include associated agents with tools and collections in the response
schema.title: Include Agents

parameters.description: Include associated agents with tools and collections in the response

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

patch.description:
Update team configuration, instructions, model, or settings.
    
    Setting is_default=true will unset other default teams as only one default team
    is allowed per project. Team must belong to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

delete.description:
Soft delete a team by its UUID. Associated agents will have their team_id set to null
    but will remain active. Team must belong to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

get.description:
Retrieve all AI agents for the authenticated project with filtering and pagination.
    
    Agents are AI entities that can be configured with specific models, instructions, and tools.
    All results are automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Create a new AI agent within the authenticated project.
    
    Agents can be configured with specific LLM models, system instructions, and tool bindings.
    Only one default agent is allowed per project. Agent is automatically scoped to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific AI agent including tool bindings
    and collection access if requested. Agent must belong to the authenticated project.

parameters.name: include_tools

schema.description: Include tool bindings in the response
schema.title: Include Tools

parameters.description: Include tool bindings in the response

parameters.name: include_collections

schema.description: Include collection bindings in the response
schema.title: Include Collections

parameters.description: Include collection bindings in the response

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

patch.description:
Update AI agent configuration, tools, or settings.
    
    You can modify agent name, instruction, model, team association, tool bindings,
    and default agent status. Agent must belong to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

delete.description:
Soft delete an AI agent by its UUID. The agent will be marked as deleted but
    preserved for audit purposes. Agent must belong to the authenticated project.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description: Cancel a running supervisor agent execution by client_msg_no. If the run has not yet started (run_id unknown), the cancellation will be queued and sent immediately on start.

schema.title: Response Cancel By Client No V1 Ai Runs Cancel By Client Post

get.description:
Retrieve multiple tools by their IDs in a single request (order preserved).
    This proxies the AI service MCP endpoint for efficient batch fetching.

schema.description: List of tool IDs to fetch
schema.title: Ids

parameters.description: List of tool IDs to fetch

schema.title: Response Get Tools By Ids V1 Mcp Tools Batch Get

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of available tools from the MCP service via AI service.
    
    This endpoint provides access to both MCP server tools and custom webhook tools
    with filtering capabilities by source type, status, and search terms.

parameters.name: source_type

schema.description: Filter by tool source type (MCP_SERVER, CUSTOM)
schema.title: Source Type

parameters.description: Filter by tool source type (MCP_SERVER, CUSTOM)

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by tool status (ACTIVE, INACTIVE, DEPRECATED)
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter by tool status (ACTIVE, INACTIVE, DEPRECATED)

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Search term for tool name or description
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Search term for tool name or description

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific tool by ID from the MCP service.
    
    Returns complete tool information including input schema, configuration,
    and execution details.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

post.description:
Create a new custom webhook tool in the MCP service via AI service.
    
    Custom tools allow you to integrate external services by providing a webhook URL
    that will be called when the tool is executed. The tool must include a JSON schema
    for input validation.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

put.description:
Update an existing custom webhook tool in the MCP service via AI service.
    
    Only custom tools can be updated. You can modify the webhook URL, input schema,
    timeout settings, and other configuration options.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

delete.description:
Delete a custom webhook tool from the MCP service via AI service.
    
    Only custom tools can be deleted. This action is irreversible and will
    also remove the tool from all projects where it was installed.

post.description:
Execute a tool installed in the project via the MCP service through AI service.
    
    The tool must be installed and enabled in the current project. Provide input data
    according to the tool's input schema. The execution is asynchronous and returns
    immediately with execution details.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of tools installed in the project via AI service MCP integration.
    
    Returns detailed information about each tool installation including configuration,
    status, and associated tool details.

parameters.name: source_type

schema.description: Filter by tool source type (MCP_SERVER, CUSTOM)
schema.title: Source Type

parameters.description: Filter by tool source type (MCP_SERVER, CUSTOM)

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by tool status (ACTIVE, INACTIVE, DEPRECATED)
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter by tool status (ACTIVE, INACTIVE, DEPRECATED)

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Search term for tool name or description
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Search term for tool name or description

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

get.description:
Retrieve statistics for tool installations in the project via AI service MCP integration.

    Returns comprehensive statistics including total installations, enabled/disabled counts,
    tool source type breakdown, and recent activity metrics.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific tool installation in the project.

    Returns complete information about the tool installation including configuration,
    status, and full tool details.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

put.description:
Update a tool installation configuration via AI service MCP integration.
    
    You can modify the tool's enabled status and project-specific configuration.
    Changes take effect immediately for future tool executions.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

delete.description:
Remove a tool installation from the project via AI service MCP integration.
    
    This will disable the tool and remove it from the project. The tool itself
    remains available for installation in other projects.

post.description:
Install a tool in the project via AI service MCP integration.
    
    The tool will be made available for execution within the project with the
    specified configuration. You can optionally disable the tool after installation.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid request data or parameters

409.description: Conflict - Resource already exists or conflict with current state

post.description:
Install multiple tools in the project at once via AI service MCP integration.
    
    This is more efficient than installing tools individually. All tools will use
    the same default configuration and enabled status unless overridden.

schema.title: Response Bulk Install Tools V1 Mcp Project Tools Bulk Install Post

get.description: Get the WebSocket long connection address for a user from WuKongIM service. This endpoint does not require authentication and can be used by both staff and visitors.

post.description: Handle WuKongIM webhook callbacks.

schema.title: Response Wukongim Webhook V1 Integrations Wukongim Webhook Post

get.description: Get status of all Kafka consumer tasks for debugging.

schema.title: Response Kafka Consumer Status V1 Diagnostics Kafka Consumers Get

post.description:
Streaming chat completion endpoint.

- Auth: Platform API key in request payload (api_key)
- Behavior: Publishes message to Kafka and streams AI events over SSE
- Output: Server-Sent Events (SSE) with tokens and a final complete event

Forward a staff-authenticated outbound message to the Platform Service (`/v1/messages/send`). This endpoint enriches the payload with the platform API key and staff identifier and returns the Platform Service response.
Upload a file for a chat channel with dual authentication support.

get.description:
Serve an uploaded chat file by ID.

- Public access allowed by default
- If auth is provided (JWT or platform API key), validate access to the channel

Retrieve channel information for a given channel_id and channel_type.

Security:
- JWT staff: access to channels within the same project (existing behavior)
- Platform API key: only staff personal channels (channel_type==1 and channel_id endswith '-staff'),
  and only within the same project as the platform

extra.title: Extra
extra.description:
Scenario 1  Customer Service Channel (channel_type == 251):
- extra contains the complete VisitorResponse as a dictionary. Fields include: id, platform_id, platform_type, platform_open_id, name, nickname, avatar_url, phone_number, email, company, job_title, source, note, custom_attributes, created_at, updated_at, deleted_at, first_visit_time, last_visit_time, last_offline_time, is_online, and any other fields defined by VisitorResponse.

Scenario 2  Personal Channel - Staff (channel_type == 1 AND channel_id ends with '-staff'):
- extra contains staff metadata as a dictionary with fields: staff_id (UUID string), username (string), role (string, e.g., 'user' or 'agent').

Scenario 3  Personal Channel - Visitor (channel_type == 1 AND channel_id does NOT end with '-staff'):
- Same as Scenario 1: extra contains the complete VisitorResponse as a dictionary.

ChatCompletionRequest.title: ChatCompletionRequest
ChatCompletionRequest.description:
Request payload for streaming chat completion.

Notes:
- api_key refers to the Platform API key used by the client integration
- from_uid identifies the end-user on the client platform
- message is the chat input to be completed by AI
- timeout_seconds bounds the SSE stream duration
